dmca.title: SuperDog on the tail of copied images
dmca.body:
Dear GOOGLE:

The web site www.celebritydogtrainer.com is stealing copyrighted images from our web sites. filed a lawsuit in the Sacramento Superior Court against this person and his corporation.

Her is what you asked for on your copyright page:

1)	I David Baron owner of SuperDog, Inc. authorize Google to act on our behalf to stop the unauthorized use of our intellectual property and copyrighted material.

2)	The material stolen is a picture appearing on http://www.celebritydogtrainer.com/faq.htm#1 dogs at the top of the page.

This image appears on the header of our web site www.DogAnswers.com and on these two pages http://www.superdog.com/hints/trainers_body.html and http://www.superdog.com/hints/about

This is a picture of my own dogs that I took myself.

3)	The picture can be found on your directory when searching for dog training in various cities especially Sacramento.

4)	Our contact information is:

[private], Owner 
SuperDog, Inc.
[private]
Roseville, CA 95747 
(916)[private]
email: [private]@surewest.net
Our attorneys are: Downey Brand, LLP [private], Esquire
[private] Sacramento, CA 95814
(916)[private]

5)	Use of this material is not authorized by the copyright or intellectual property owner [us], its agents the law. I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.

6)	I affirm under penalty of perjury, that the above information in my Notice is accurate and that I am the copyright or intellectual property owner.

Thank you. Please let me know what you plan on doing.
11/3/2005
 
[private]
SuperDog, Inc.
